hasDefinedTerm.name: Pre-Purchase Upsell
hasDefinedTerm.description: An offer shown before a customer pays, modifying the current shopping cart

hasDefinedTerm.name: Post-Purchase Upsell
hasDefinedTerm.description: An offer shown after a customer completes payment, creating a new, separate transaction

hasDefinedTerm.name: Average Order Value (AOV)
hasDefinedTerm.description: A metric that measures the average total of every order placed over a defined period of time

hasDefinedTerm.name: Payment Tokenization
hasDefinedTerm.description: A security process that creates a secure, single-use token representing customer payment details without exposing raw card numbers

hasDefinedTerm.name: Customer Lifetime Value (CLV)
hasDefinedTerm.description: The total revenue a business can reasonably expect from a single customer account throughout the business relationship

hasDefinedTerm.name: Conversion Rate
hasDefinedTerm.description: The percentage of visitors who complete a desired action on a website

hasDefinedTerm.name: AJAX

supply.name: Shopify store with Shopify Payments enabled
Post-purchase upsell app (Rebuy, AfterSell, or Zipify OCU)

step.name: Install and Connect App
step.text: Install the app and grant it permissions to talk to your payment gateway

step.name: Create a Funnel
step.text: Give it a descriptive name, like 'Camera Body -> Lens Upsell'

step.name: Set the Trigger
step.text: Tell the app to fire this funnel only when a specific product is in the completed order

step.name: Build the Upsell Offer
step.text: Design the offer page, select the upsell product, write compelling copy, and add a discount if needed

step.name: Build the Downsell
step.text: Configure the funnel to offer a cheaper alternative if they decline the main upsell

step.name: Activate and Monitor
step.text: Turn on the funnel and monitor the analytics dashboard, making data-driven adjustments

mainEntity.name: How much does a pre-purchase offer really hurt the user experience?

acceptedAnswer.text: It can be brutal. A badly timed, irrelevant pre-purchase pop-up feels like a pushy salesperson blocking the aisle. A post-purchase offer is more like the cashier helpfully asking if you need batteries for the thing you just bought. The psychological state of the customer is completely different.

mainEntity.name: If I'm paranoid about my conversion rate, which one do I use?

acceptedAnswer.text: Post-purchase. It's not even a debate. Since the original order is 100% complete before the offer is ever shown, there is literally zero risk to your primary conversion rate.
